    • Method Detail

      • parseWeatherForecast

        private Weather[] parseWeatherForecast(java.lang.String data)
        This method takes the whole JSON formatted data returned by the web server when called the fetchWeather() method from the WeatherFetcher class in the constructor. Then returns 3 instances of the object Weather in an array. With the first element holding values for the present day, the next element holding the values for the next day and so on.
        Parameters:
        data - json weather data
        Returns:
        array containing the weather data

      • parseCurrentWeather

        private Weather[] parseCurrentWeather(java.lang.String data)
        Method that parses the json data to fetch the current weather
        Parameters:
        data - json data to be parsed
        Returns:
        array containing the weather data

      • getWeather

        public Weather getWeather(int i)
        Getter method that provides the requested weather from the array. The positions are 0 for current weather, 1 for the next day, 2 for the day following the next day
        Parameters:
        i - requested index
        Returns:
        Weather element

      • getDay

        private java.lang.String getDay(int i)
        Method that define the day name for the retrieved weather
        Parameters:
        i - index of the weather in the relative order as today 0, tomorrow 1, day after tomorrow 2
        Returns:
        first three letters of the day name

      • getTime

        private java.lang.String getTime()
        Method that identifies the time of the day to help the parser identify which data it should look for
        Returns:
        string containing the time such as morn (morning) or eve (evening) and so on.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        Update method where the observable classes sends notifications messages
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        o - observable object
        arg - object arg
